Despite losing his scout twice, Velez continues to play aggressively and pushes into Yo's base. He takes down one of Yo's ranges and destroys some of his buildings. However, Yo counters by sending his own army to attack Velez's base.

The game ends with Velez winning the match 3-1, showcasing his excellent strategic decision-making skills despite being at a disadvantage due to lack of vision.

The Resurgence is a tournament hosted by Jordan "Hera" Walker, featuring some of the top Age of Empires II players in the world. The finals were between Yoan "Yo" Kouli and Vales "Vales" Benevolent, with Yo emerging victorious 5-1.

The first game saw both players start off strong, but it was Vales who took an early lead after pushing his sheep into Hera's base and destroying his Town Center. However, Yo managed to recover quickly and eventually pushed his own sheep into Vales' base, destroying his Town Center as well. With both players having lost their Town Centers, they transitioned into Castle Age. In the end, Yo won the game due to better micro management and more efficient use of resources.

In Game 2, Vales opted for a Feitoria strategy while Yo went for a standard Galleon rush. Despite being outnumbered, Vales managed to hold off Yo's initial attack and even counterattack, forcing Yo to switch to a different strategy. The game ended in a draw after both players ran out of time.

Game 3 saw Vales once again go for a Feitoria strategy, this time with more success. He was able to build up a large army and push into Yo's base, ultimately winning the game.

For Game 4, Yo switched things up by going for a fast fire ship strategy. This proved to be effective as he was able to take down Vales' castle and win the game.

In Game 5, Vales returned to his Feitoria strategy, but this time Yo countered with a fast fire ship and monk strategy. This combination proved too much for Vales, as Yo was able to take down his castle and win the game.

With the series tied at 2-2, Game 6 saw both players revert back to their original strategies from earlier games. Vales went for a Feitoria strategy while Yo went for a fast fire ship and monk strategy. Once again, Yo's combination proved to be more effective, allowing him to take down Vales' castle and win the game.

With the series now tied at 3-3, Game 7 saw both players make some adjustments to their strategies. Vales went for a Feitoria strategy with a focus on organ guns, while Yo went for a fast fire ship and monk strategy. This time, Yo's monks were able to break through Vales' defenses and take down his castle, securing the victory and the championship title.

Overall, the Resurgence Finals showcased some incredible gameplay from both Yo and Vales. While Vales demonstrated the power of the Feitoria strategy, Yo showed that a well-executed fast fire ship and monk strategy could be just as effective. Both players displayed excellent micro management skills throughout the series, making for an exciting and competitive conclusion to the tournament.
